subject: Photography
title: Diagonal Lines and Energy
description: One-minute skill: Diagonal Lines and Energy.

hook.text: Horizontal lines feel calm. Vertical lines feel strong. Diagonal lines feel alive with energy and motion.

buildup.text: Diagonals create dynamic tension in a frame. They suggest movement, instability, or action.

discovery.text: Tilting the camera slightly can turn static lines into diagonals, injecting energy into an otherwise flat scene.

twist.text: Too much tilt looks careless, not creative. The difference between dynamic and sloppy is about five degrees.

climax.text: Diagonal composition is a favorite of sports and action photographers. It mirrors the energy of the moment.

punchline.text: Tilt a line and it starts moving. So does the viewer's eye.

quiz.question: What emotional quality do diagonal lines add to a photograph?
